title: Accelerating satellite production timelines improving market health
summary: Satellite makers are hopeful that higher frequency production rates will facilitate more innovation in the market, and fortify supply chains disrupted by the pandemic.

title: EGS, Jacobs preparing Artemis 1 vehicle at pad for final pre-launch countdown test
summary: The launch team, made up of people from NASA’s Exploration Ground Systems (EGS) program and prime launch processing contractor Jacobs, is preparing to conduct the final test prior to the launch of the Artemis 1 mission to the Moon. Following the rollout of the first integrated Orion spacecraft and Space Launch System (SLS) rocket to Launch Pad 39B at the Kennedy Space Center in Florida overnight on March 17 into March 18, the Artemis 1 vehicle and the Mobile Launcher are being connected to pad services and powered up for testing.

title: Millennium Space to launch to orbit a 3D printed satellite structure
summary: Millennium Space Systems plans to launch to orbit a 3D printed metal flight structure the company intends to use to build its next generation of satellite buses.

title: Arianespace and SpaceX work to adjust launch manifests
summary: Arianespace says it is working to remanifest payloads that were to launch on Soyuz rockets while SpaceX says it’s finding ways to accommodate new customers on its vehicles.

title: NASA, ESA Assign Astronauts to Space Station Mission on Crew Dragon
summary: NASA and ESA (European Space Agency) have selected two astronauts to launch on NASA’s SpaceX Crew-7 mission to the International Space Station.

title: NASA's Ingenuity Helicopter and Asteroid-Monitoring System Honored
summary: The team behind the agency's history-making rotorcraft soars, picking up high-profile awards alongside a new-and-improved system to assess asteroid orbits.

title: Astronauts complete spacewalk for space station maintenance and upgrades
summary: Two astronauts floated outside the International Space Station Wednesday and installed refurbished ammonia jumpers in the lab’s cooling system to bring it back up to full efficiency, replaced a high-definition camera and made power and data connections on a European experiment platform.

title: NASA to support development of second Artemis lunar lander
summary: NASA announced March 23 that it will support development of a second lander to transport astronauts to and from the lunar surface to provide competition with SpaceX for the later “sustainable” phase of the Artemis program.

title: La NASA te invita a enviar tu nombre a la Luna, ¡ahora en español!
summary: La NASA invita a la gente a enviar sus nombres para que sean incluidos en una memoria USB que irá a bordo de la nave espacial Orion durante la misión Artemis I de la agencia. Y, ahora, los participantes pueden obtener sus tarjetas de embarque Artemis en español.

title: NASA Invites Public to Send their Name to Moon – Now in Spanish!
summary: NASA is inviting people to send their names to be included on a flash drive that will fly on the Orion spacecraft during the agency’s Artemis I mission – and now people can obtain their Artemis boarding passes in Spanish.
